about.summary: Provides a dataset of predefined color palettes based on the Star Trek science fiction series, associated color palette functions, and additional functions for generating customized palettes that are on theme. The package also offers functions for applying the palettes to plots made using the 'ggplot2' package.

name: r-trekcolors
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.1.1' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}
{% set native = 'm2w64-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-trekcolors
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/trekcolors_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/trekcolors/trekcolors_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 70e6ef88e1dc444ed5e6012d68b5d4b63157b720960da693dfe9f839e7e382bb

build:
  merge_build_host: True  # [win]
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-ggplot2
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-ggplot2

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('trekcolors')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('trekcolors')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://github.com/leonawicz/trekcolors
  license: MIT
  summary: Provides a dataset of predefined color palettes based on the Star Trek science fiction
    series, associated color palette functions, and additional functions for generating
    customized palettes that are on theme. The package also offers functions for applying
    the palettes to plots made using the 'ggplot2' package.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT'
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: trekcolors
# Title: Star Trek Color Palettes
# Version: 0.1.1
# Authors@R: person("Matthew", "Leonawicz", email = "matt_leonawicz@esource.com", role = c("aut", "cre"), comment = c(ORCID = "0000-0001-9452-2771"))
# Description: Provides a dataset of predefined color palettes based on the Star Trek science fiction series, associated color palette functions, and additional functions for generating customized palettes that are on theme. The package also offers functions for applying the palettes to plots made using the 'ggplot2' package.
# License: MIT + file LICENSE
# Encoding: UTF-8
# LazyData: true
# URL: https://github.com/leonawicz/trekcolors
# BugReports: https://github.com/leonawicz/trekcolors/issues
# Depends: R (>= 2.10)
# Imports: ggplot2
# Suggests: testthat, knitr, rmarkdown, covr
# RoxygenNote: 6.1.1
# Language: en-US
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2019-10-15 02:52:51 UTC; Matt
# Author: Matthew Leonawicz [aut, cre] (<https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9452-2771>)
# Maintainer: Matthew Leonawicz <matt_leonawicz@esource.com>
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2019-10-16 11:50:03 UTC
smithy_version:
No azure token. Create a token and
put it in ~/.conda-smithy/azure.token
3.7.0
